description: Organize your content with unordered, ordered, and description lists.

slides.title: Types of Lists
slides.content:
# HTML Lists ğŸ“‹

HTML lists allow you to group a set of related items.

There are three main types:
1. **Unordered Lists** (bullet points) - `<ul>`
2. **Ordered Lists** (numbers/letters) - `<ol>`
3. **Description Lists** (terms and definitions) - `<dl>`

Let's assume you're making a grocery list... unordered is best!

slides.title: Unordered Lists
slides.content:
# Unordered Lists ğŸ¥£ Use `
    ` for items where the order doesn't matter. It creates bullet points. - The list starts with `
      `. - Each item starts with `
    • ` (List Item). ```html
      • Coffee
      • Tea
      • Milk
      ``` Result: * Coffee * Tea * Milk

slides.title: Unordered Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which tag defines an unordered list?

slides.title: Ordered Lists
slides.content:
# Ordered Lists ğŸ”¢ Use `
    ` for items where order matters. It creates numbered items. - The list starts with `
      `. - Each item starts with `
    1. `. ```html
      1. Wake up
      2. Brush teeth
      3. Eat breakfast
      ``` Result: 1. Wake up 2. Brush teeth 3. Eat breakfast

slides.title: List Item Markers
slides.content:
# Customizing Markers ğŸ¨ You can change the marker type using the `type` attribute or CSS. ## Ordered List Types - `type="1"`: Numbers (default) - `type="A"`: Uppercase letters - `type="a"`: Lowercase letters - `type="I"`: Roman numerals ```html
  1. First
  2. Second
``` ## Unordered List CSS `list-style-type: square;` (disc, circle, square, none)

slides.title: Description Lists
slides.content:
# Description Lists ğŸ“–

A description list (`<dl>`) groups terms with their descriptions.

- `<dt>`: The **term** (name).
- `<dd>`: The **description** (details).

```html
<dl>
  <dt>HTML</dt>
  <dd>HyperText Markup Language</dd>
  <dt>CSS</dt>
  <dd>Cascading Style Sheets</dd>
</dl>
```

Result:
HTML
  HyperText Markup Language
CSS
  Cascading Style Sheets

slides.title: Nested Lists
slides.content:
# Nested Lists ğŸ“¦ Lists can be nested inside lists. ```html
  • Coffee
  • Tea
    • Black tea
    • Green tea
  • Milk
``` > ğŸ’¡ **Tip:** Be careful with closing tags! The nested `
    ` should be *inside* the `
  • ` tag of the parent item.

slides.title: Styling Lists
List Attributes
slides.content:
# List Attributes âš™ï¸ Ordered lists have useful attributes: - `start`: Specifies the start value of an ordered list. - `reversed`: Reverses the numbering order. ```html
  1. Item 50
  2. Item 51
  1. Item 3
  2. Item 2
  3. Item 1
```
